|ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Arcadyan |manuf_model = WG8015 |manuf_rev = G22 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = FreshTomato-MIPS, TomatoUSB |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/06/2012 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43236B;BCM43236BKMLG, HT1208 P21, 186641 6 W; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "P/N: 141801620001J R01" is silk-screened on the board in the FCC photos. ==Links of Interest== ===Original Forum thread=== *[https://www.linksysinfo.org/index.php?threads/belkin-f9k1102-tomato-bring-up.70850/ Belkin F9K1102: Tomato bring-up] ===FreshTomato=== *[https://freshtomato.org/ ''To Know more about FreshTomato''] ===Download link=== *[https://freshtomato.org/downloads/freshtomato-mips/ ''Navigate by year, year-build#, K26RT-N folder Always use current builds! *Note both version 1 and 3 are supported on the same firmware build.''] ===Flashing Instruction link=== *[https://www.linksysinfo.org/index.php?threads/belkin-f9k1102-tomato-bring-up.70850/post-327032 '' Flashing Instructions'']. ===Linksysinfo Forum=== *[https://www.linksysinfo.org/index.php ''for FreshTomato firmware support''] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Tomato=== When changing to FreshTomato, if the reset button does not reset nvram, the default password may be unknown. The password can be retrieved from the unprotected console via 'nvram get http_passwd'. User is 'root' for telnet, ssh, and GUI. After a proper reset, the password is 'admin'. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ===Serial=== Terminal settings: * Baud: 115200 * Data bits: 8 * Stop Bits: 1 * Parity: none * Flow control: none ====Serial Pinouts==== 
_ = (GND)
3 = (RxD)
2 = (TxD)
1 = [3.3v]
J3
{{/Serial info}} [[Category:English Documentation]]
